      • getFamilyName

        public java.lang.String getFamilyName()
        Description copied from interface: IntentionAction
        Returns the name of the family of intentions. It is used to externalize "auto-show" state of intentions. When the user clicks on a light bulb in intention list, all intentions with the same family name get enabled/disabled. The name is also shown in settings tree.
        Specified by:
        getFamilyName in interface IntentionAction
        Specified by:
        getFamilyName in interface QuickFix<ProblemDescriptor>
        Specified by:
        getFamilyName in class IntentionAndQuickFixAction
        Returns:
        text to appear in "Apply Fix" popup when multiple Quick Fixes exist (in the results of batch code inspection). For example, if the name of the quickfix is "Create template <filename>", the return value of getFamilyName() should be "Create template". If the name of the quickfix does not depend on a specific element, simply return QuickFix.getName().
        See Also:
        IntentionManager.registerIntentionAndMetaData(IntentionAction, String...)

      • startInWriteAction

        public boolean startInWriteAction()
        Description copied from interface: WriteActionAware
        Indicate whether this action should be invoked inside write action.

        Should return false if e.g. modal dialog is shown inside the action. If false is returned the action itself is responsible for starting write action when needed, by calling Application.runWriteAction(Runnable).

        Specified by:
        startInWriteAction in interface IntentionAction
        Specified by:
        startInWriteAction in interface WriteActionAware
        Overrides:
        startInWriteAction in class IntentionAndQuickFixAction
        Returns:
        true if the action requires a write action (default), false otherwise.
